{"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "JobPosting", "datePosted": "2021-08-25T17:24:28.000Z", "description": "

Are you interested in joining a winning team? A team whose employees are empowered to make a difference? Our culture is one of honesty, integrity and transparency with an emphasis on safety, health and environmental performance.


On our team people are acknowledged for embracing new ideas that help create real value for customers. Let\u2019s get there together.

 

INEOS Composites is a global chemicals business with sales volume of 320 kte and revenue in excess of $1 billion. The Composites business has 6 manufacturing operations in the US, 1 in Brazil, 4 in Europe, 2 in China along with offices and headquarters in Ohio, Barcelona and Shanghai. The Composites Business primary products include unsaturated polyester resins (UPRs), vinyl ester resins (VERs) and gel coats. 


INEOS has an exciting opportunity for an Account Manager to join our INEOS Composites business. This role will act as the voice of the customer to the organization, and also the voice of the organization to the customer, Grow profitable sales in their assigned territory/accounts. Primary role to negotiate contracts/sales agreements with existing and prospective customers, utilizing sales management resources, where necessary. Single point of accountability for the customer interface.


**The ideal candidate will be based in NC and will be responsible for portions of TN, NC, SC, GA, WV, VA.

 

Responsibilities include:

Maintain existing sales and identify new opportunities

\u2022          Gain knowledge of customer\u2019s business

\u2022          Develop key relationships at all level of customer

\u2022          Identifying customer expectations and matching them to Ineos capabilities

\u2022          Utilize internal systems to develop an offer and prepare for customer negotiation.

\u2022          Successfully negotiate sales agreements, utilizing sales management resources, where necessary

 

Meet established annual objectives to deliver volumes and margins for their assigned territory

\u2022          Ability to effectively utilize Ineos forecasting tools

\u2022          Negotiate pricing at market-based accounts

\u2022          Develop realistic forecasts

\u2022          Clear understanding of customer\u2019s markets that could affect forecast/delivery of plan

\u2022          Monitor results and develop options for management consideration of corrective action

\u2022          Identify market conditions and competitive activity affecting plan delivery.

 

Develop/maintain strong customer relationships, and increase customer loyalty and customer satisfaction.          

\u2022          Become a source of industry information to the customer  

\u2022          Listen to customer needs/concerns and recommend timely solutions

\u2022          Be proactive, not reactive to market conditions,

\u2022          Communication, communication, communication

\u2022          Encourage Ineos to provide an \u201ceasy to do business with environment\u201d

\u2022          Utilize Ineos resources appropriately to continuously create value in the customer relationship

 

Ensure customer responsibilities of relationship are met

\u2022          Accurate and timely input of forecasts/order placement

\u2022          Payment of invoices within established terms

\u2022          Increase utilization of rail fleet, by ensuring timely release of railcars from customer\u2019s facilities.

 

 

 

The ideal candidate will possess the following:

Bachelor\u2019s degree

A minimum of 5 years of value added selling ideally within the chemical industry.

Knowledge of gel-coats, fiberglass, polyester resin is strongly desired.

Ability to listen and develop solutions

Strong relationship building ability
